name: Mushrooms
description: Psilocybin mushrooms are a family of psychoactive mushrooms that contain the psychedelic tryptamine psilocybin. Psilocybin mushrooms occur on all continents and have been taxonomically classified into over 200 species, the most potent of which belong to the genus Psilocybe.
effectsDesc: Like other psychedelics, psilocybin mushrooms produce their effects by acting on serotonin receptors in the brain. The hallucinogenic effects of psilocybin usually occur within 30 minutes of ingestion and last between 4 and 6 hours.
effects: analysis enhancement -  this effect is consistent in its manifestation and outrospection dominant
colour enhancement - relative to other psychedelics, this effect may appear to be more saturated
emotion enhancement - this effect can be described as being more prominent, consistent and profound when compared to other traditional psychedelics such as mescaline or LSD
spirituality enhancement, auditory enhancement, existential self-realization, unity and interconnectedness and much more...
safetyTips: don't be on your own, have someone you know looking after you
be in a good mood before use
risks: may trigger or exacerbate symptoms (e.g. delusions, mania, psychosis) in those who have or are predisposed to mental illness such as bipolar disorder or schizophrenia
poisioning due to ingesting a different species of mushroom which can be lethal
